title: A's bang out a deal with Thomas
subtitle: A's bang out a deal with Thomas
body: Frank Thomas spent 16 seasons rewriting the Chicago White Sox record books. He will now have a chance to write at least a few chapters for the A's.  Oakland on Wednesday afternoon announced a one-year agreement with the 37-year-old slugger, hoping he can still put a Big Hurt on the rest of the American League.  If this is a shared risk, most of it is being borne by Thomas. Coming off two seasons marred by fractures to his left ankle, he agreed to a classic incentive-laden make-good contract. "When Frank is healthy, he is a huge right-handed presence," Beane said. "And that's been a big issue for us the last couple of years."                Tom Singer is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Tom Singer
